messageBody:
On Friday 24 June 2005 01:16, Kent Beck wrote:
> Chris,
>
> The existence of the Composite pattern in the Test/TestCase/TestSuite
> troika caused us problems. It was difficult to explain and it made writing
> test runners more difficult. One particularly vexing problem was re-running
> single tests while making sure all the TestDecorators and TestSuite
> subclasses higher in the test tree were run correctly.

Ah. OK, that I hadn't thought of - and I have been peeved when I
haven't been able to rerun a single failing test (in Eclipse) because
of some contextual problem, so now I see the motivation.

> Now we are encountering just how heavily used TestDecorator and TestSuite
> subclassing are used in JUnit extensions. Our challenge is to provide
> equivalently powerful extension mechanisms while retaining the simplicity
> of the new approach.

We use one (two if you count a contrib as well as the main-line code)
TestSutup decorators in our (Jena) test suite, both for doing once-only
setup for database tests - essentially, ensure that there's a clean
(empty) database to work with. So it would be nice if there was at
least the machinery for doing something similar.

[I've twice printed, and twice lost before reading, the JUnit 4 into
doc ... maybe this weekend, since it looks unlikely that I'll be
mowing the lawn ...]

Thank you for unpacking. It's nice to know that it was my sanity
that needed checking.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
